articles.description: Increasing evidence suggests people who smoke are more likely to become severely ill and die from COVID-19 than nonsmokers. Some people are using that as inspiration to quit.
articles.content:
Research indicates that smokers and vapers are at increased risk of more serious illness if they get infected with the novel coronavirus.
Tegra Stone Nuess/Getty Images
In 40 years of smoking, Katie Kennedy has tried four times to quit but always went back … [+8314 chars]

articles.title: Chicago during 1918 Spanish flu pandemic used similar measures like face masks, faced similar pressures to reopen as COVID-19 - WLS-TV
articles.description: The push to reopen the economy while protecting public health is not new to the U.S. or Chicago; it happened just over 100 years ago, during the Spanish flu.

articles.title: Royal Australian Air Force unveils unmanned Boeing aircraft - Yahoo Lifestyle
articles.description: It is a major milestone for Boeing as well as Australia — which hasn't built an aircraft start-to-finish in 50 years.
articles.content:
The Royal Australian Air Force and Boeing Australia unveiled the first military aircraft designed in Australia in over 50 years.

articles.title: 108-year-old man may be the oldest survivor of COVID-19 - KCRA Sacramento
articles.description: “I didn’t even know I had it. … I guess if I knew I had it I might have been scared.”
articles.content:
At 108, Phil Corio is certainly one of the oldest people in New Mexico and the U.S.
But now the Los Ranchos resident has a new claim to fame: he just might be the oldest person in the world to survive COVID-19.
